vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/a79b74cd-ce2a-435a-9250-ad5453874690">ZIMBABWE</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>General - Education</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>OECD Education Statistics</i> database contains an up-to-date array of comparative education statistics and indicators from OECD and non-OECD countries. It provides information on the human and financial resources invested in education, on access to, progression and completion of education, on how education and learning systems operate, and on the returns to educational investments.  The database is updated on an annual basis and runs from 1985 onwards for some tables.<br> <br> These data were first provided by the UK Data Service in January 2007. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its <i>OECD Education Statistics</i> holdings, including a <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/education-statistics.aspx" title="OECD Education Statistics dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/educ/2009" title="OECD Education Statistics latest database updates">latest database updates</a>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the database is: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (<i>{YYYY}</i>): OECD Education Statistics (<i>{Ed. Data download: YYYY-MM}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/educ/2009">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/educ/2009</a>}</i>. <br> <br> <b>Alternative DOIs:</b> <a href="http://www.oecd-ilibrary.org/education/data/oecd-education-statistics_edu-data-en" title="10.1787/edu-data-en">10.1787/edu-data-en</a> (to access via OECD.Stat subscription).<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The database covers:<ul><li>education expenditures</li><li>education personnel</li><li>foreign students</li><li>graduates by age</li><li>number of students</li><li>total population</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>The OECD Education Statistics run from 1985 onwards for some tables</timePrd>         <nation>Multi-nation</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>Countries covered include: Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, Chile, China, Czech Republic, Denmark, Egypt, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Indonesia, India, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Jamaica, Jordan, Japan, Korea, Luxembourg, Malaysia, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Peru, Paraguay, Poland, Portugal, Philippines, Russia, Slovakia, Spain, Sri Lanka, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, Thailand, Tunisia, United Kingdom, United States, Uruguay, Zimbabwe</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>the database is updated annually</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See documentation for details</sampProc>         <collMode>See documentation for details</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used.
